title: 110_hr1847
content: The "National Trails System Willing Seller Act" allows for the acquisition of land from willing sellers for certain trails. The National Trails System Act is amended to require consent from landowners for the acquisition of land outside federally administered areas for the Oregon and Mormon Pioneer National Historic Trails. The Federal Government's authority to acquire fee title is limited to an average of not more than 1/4 mile on either side of the trail. The Federal Government must obtain consent from landowners to acquire land outside federally administered areas for the Continental Divide National Scenic Trail and the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail. Acquisition of fee title is limited to an average of not more than 1/4 mile on either side of the trail. The National Trails System Act is amended to require consent from landowners for acquiring land outside federally administered areas for specific national scenic trails. Acquisition of fee title is limited to an average of not more than 1/4 mile on either side of the trail. The National Trails System Act now requires landowner consent for acquiring land outside federally administered areas for specific national scenic trails, limiting fee title acquisition to an average of not more than 1/4 mile on either side of the trail. The Nez Perce National Historic Trail amendment requires landowner consent for acquiring land outside federally administered areas, limiting fee title acquisition to an average of not more than 1/4 mile on either side of the trail. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENT. Section 10 of the National Trails System Act is amended to authorize appropriations for the Natchez Trace National Scenic Trail, with specific limits on funding for land acquisition. The Natchez Trace National Scenic Trail may receive up to $2,000,000 for development, with encouragement for volunteer trail groups to participate.
